entity.name: Earth Day
entity.description: this entity for all years for Earth Day

tweets.text: It is now time to restore & rewild our barrier-wrecked rivers. More natural watercourses, are cleaner & less flood-prone, with much more wildlife. Migratory fish have declined globally by 76% since 1970 & will only be saved by removing man-made barriers.üêü#EarthDay2021 @EnvAgency https://t.co/uhamH3JRsk

We have received a number of reports regarding brown discolouration and pollution to Steeton Beck, Steeton near Keighley.  

We are in attendance and are investigating, to try and find the source. https://t.co/D0aOHjdfTD

I've never seen so many lamprey as yesterday! These are river lamprey the rarest of the three species and one of our rarest freshwater fish. I imagine many rivers would of had this site before so many barriers were erected blocking their migration. 
#lamprey #rivers https://t.co/Ght9MiKrlb

tweets.text:
Our members at @EnvAgency have been on the frontline of the climate emergency.

Prospect rep Jon Hollis blogs for #EarthDay on how his work helps to improve the environment, protect habitats and increase biodiversity. https://t.co/zgSm3PNxwg

(3/3) Anyone who witnesses this type of criminal activity being carried out is asked not to approach those responsible and to call the @EnvAgency incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60 (24-hour) - or contact @CrimestoppersUK  anonymously by calling 0800 555 111.
(2/3) The @EnvAgency Crime Team have been made aware and will be conducting their own investigations which the council will support.

(1/3) We have received a report of what is believed to be an incident of organised illegal dumping of trommel fines - material that comes from the mechanical treatment of waste - at the unused former Lord St Helens tip off Lea Green Road. https://t.co/rwdmTbtNKd

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

entity.name: Scandal
entity.description: Olivia Pope, a former media relations consultant to the president, is ready to move on with her life and opens her own crisis-management firm, but she can't seem to shake ties with her past. Pope's staff includes womaniser-turned-family man Stephen Finch, slick litigator Harrison Wright and hacker extraordinaire Huck. As she moves forward it becomes clear that while her staffers may specialise in cleaning up the lives of other people, they can't seem to do the same for themselves.

urls.description: WALLEY'S QUARRY - MEETING WITH GEORGE EUSTICE This morning I spoke with George Eustice, the Environment Secretary, about Walley's Quarry. I emphasised both the magnitude of our odour issue and the...

tweets.text:
Huge thanks to Environment Secretary George Eustice for meeting me about Walley's Quarry. I emphasised both the awfulness of our odour issue and the huge area it is now affecting.

Huge thanks too to @MattHancock for his help on the public health angle.

https://t.co/XiSVuaDgoE https://t.co/IT3hnmaDM5
